subhead: Despite the ceasefire that was declared on October 10, Israel has continued to raze many buildings east of the 'yellow line' in the Gaza Strip, according to local residents and satellite images of the enclave.

title: US Federal Reserve cuts rates amid division among governors over the state of the US economy
subhead: On December 10, the US central bank reduced its rates by a quarter point. Donald Trump is expected to name the successor to its chair, Jerome Powell, in the coming days.

title: The power gems on display in Paris
subhead: Opals and cameos of Empress Josephine, an emerald tiara once worn by Queen Victoria, diamond aigrettes of maharajas:  At the Hôtel de la Marine, the exhibition 'Dynastic Jewels' offers a rare glimpse into the jewelry collections of historical figures.

title: PSG mulls locations for new home, pending local elections
subhead: After several years of unsuccessful talks with City Hall regarding the purchase of the Parc des Princes, the club is conducting in-depth studies in Massy and Poissy, two cities in the Paris region, for the construction of a new home ground.

Achille Mbembe, philosopher: 'We will see more coups d'état in Africa'
subhead: Following the attempted coup in Benin on December 7, the Cameroonian philosopher and political scientist Achille Mbembe believes that Africa is now a continent where 'force and power are stripped down to the essentials.'

title: The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth
subhead: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge, according to the third report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty. Political choices can reverse these trends, the authors say.

title: France's far-right Rassemblement National wants to reopen brothels
